segments.text: I simply cannot comprehend how she doesn't notice the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's literally pouring over the front of the sink, directly onto her foot.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She just stands there, calmly drying that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her expression is completely neutral, as if nothing is amiss in the slightest.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Don't people usually feel cold water on their feet, even when distracted?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It almost makes me angry, this level of complete obliviousness to her surroundings.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children's antics are happening right behind her, unnoticed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She must be so incredibly focused, or perhaps completely lost in thought.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stack of clean dishes on the counter waits patiently for her attention.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This kitchen is slowly but surely becoming a watery hazard zone.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone is going to slip and fall, I just know it will happen soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's truly a baffling display of concentrated indifference to the unfolding mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I've never seen such a tranquil disaster quietly occurring.
segments.speaker: PAR
